name: Introduction to Film Studies
description: This course provides an introduction to the study of film and media, emphasizing the development of critical skills in analysis, interpretation, and cultural context.

name: Documentary Film Theory
description: This course explores the theoretical and philosophical aspects of documentary film, including its history, aesthetics, and ethical implications.

name: Documentary Production
description: This course provides an introduction to the technical aspects of documentary filmmaking, including digital and analog production and post-production techniques.

name: Documentary Film History
description: This course examines the history of documentary film, from its inception to the present day, with a focus on the development of key aesthetic and thematic trends.

name: Advanced Documentary Production
description: This course is a more in-depth exploration of the technical aspects of documentary filmmaking, with a focus on advanced production and post-production techniques.
